message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.MM, cs.LG, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with fitting a 3D Morphable Face Model to 2D images using local image features. This involves computer vision (CV) techniques such as feature extraction and image processing. Therefore, cs.CV is the most likely sub-category. The paper also involves machine learning (ML) techniques such as learning-based cascaded regression, which learns the gradient direction from data. This makes cs.GR and cs.MM likely sub-categories as well. The paper also mentions the robustness of local features against variations in imaging conditions, which could fall under the sub-category of machine learning (cs.LG). Finally, the paper proposes a novel fitting method, which involves solving for shape and pose parameters, and could be considered as an artificial intelligence (AI) problem, making cs.AI a possible sub-category.
